qas.question: What writing mentions the Arian accusation that Athanasius was under aged?
At what age was a man eligible to be ordained at Patriarch of Alexandria?
What year did Cornelius Clifford attend the Maximian persecution?
When was Cornelius Clifford ordained as Patriarch of Alexandria?
What church does Cornelius Clifford belong to?
How old was Cornelius Clifford when he joined The Orthodox Church?
What writing denies that the Arian accusation that Athanasius was under aged?
At what age was a woman eligible to be ordained at Patriarch of Alexandria?
What is the age of 20 called?

context: However Cornelius Clifford places his birth no earlier than <b3_0>296<b3_0/> and no later than 298, based on the fact that Athanasius indicates no first hand recollection of the <a0_0><b8_0>Maximian persecution<b8_0/><a0_0/> of <b4_0>303<b4_0/>, which he suggests Athanasius would have remembered if he had been <b7_0>ten years old<b7_0/> at the time. Secondly, <a1_0>the <b9_0>Festal Epistles<b9_0/><a1_0/> state that the Arians had accused Athanasius, among other charges, of not having yet attained the <a2_0><b11_0>canonical age<b11_0/> (<b10_0>30<b10_0/>)<a2_0/> and thus could not have been properly ordained as Patriarch of Alexandria in <b5_0>328<b5_0/>. The accusation must have seemed plausible. <b6_0>The Orthodox Church<b6_0/> places his year of birth around 297.
